questions.question: In the process of setting up single sign on using SAML 2.0, an external IdP metadata file is
questions.explanation: SAML 2.0 metadata is always provided in XML format. The metadata file contains essential configuration information such as entity IDs, endpoints (URLs), certificates, and other SAML-specific settings needed for establishing the trust relationship between the Service Provider (SP) and Identity Provider (IdP).

reference.document: Saviynt Enterprise IGA Documentation - SSO Configuration Guide

questions.question: Saviynt EIC can support multiple identity providers for single sign on
questions.explanation: Saviynt EIC supports the configuration of multiple Identity Providers (IdPs) for Single Sign-On (SSO). This allows users to authenticate through different identity sources, providing flexibility and accommodating various organizational structures or partner requirements.

reference.document: Saviynt Enterprise IGA Documentation - SSO Configuration Guide

questions.question: ___ is always time-bound and can be requested only for a specific period
questions.explanation: Emergency access roles are designed to grant elevated privileges for a limited time, typically in response to urgent situations. These roles are time-bound to ensure that access is revoked once the emergency is resolved, reducing the risk of unauthorized access.

reference.document: Saviynt Enterprise IGA Documentation - Access Request Settings

questions.question: What configuration types are needed to set up an emergency access role request?
options: Select a workflow under global configurations
Select emergency access-related parameters in the role-level configurations
Select required feature access in SAV Role Configurations
questions.explanation:
To set up an emergency access role request in Saviynt, the following configurations are necessary:
- Workflow selection under global configurations: This defines the approval process for emergency access requests.
- Role-level configuration of emergency access parameters: Role-specific settings ensure that only designated roles can be requested for emergency access.
- Feature access in SAV Role Configurations: Required feature access must be enabled to support emergency role requests.

This comprehensive setup ensures that emergency access is managed properly with appropriate approvals and restrictions.

reference.document: Saviynt Enterprise IGA Documentation - Access Request Settings

questions.question: Access request approval is not being assigned to the correct approver for a given endpoint. In this scenario, what configurations will you check?
options: Verify the workflow attached to the corresponding Security System to ensure it is correctly configured
Verify if Delegate is configured for the intended approver
Verify the workflow attached to the corresponding endpoint to ensure it is correctly configured
Verify the requestor selected the correct approver while submitting the request
answer: Verify the workflow attached to the corresponding Security System to ensure it is correctly configured
Verify the workflow attached to the corresponding endpoint to ensure it is correctly configured
questions.explanation: In Saviynt, workflows define how access requests are routed for approvals. If approvals are not being assigned correctly, the issue could lie in the workflow configuration at either the Security System level or the Endpoint level. The Security System workflow ensures that general access requests for connected systems follow the defined approval chain, while the Endpoint workflow handles specific application-level access requests. Misconfigured workflows at either level can result in requests being routed to the wrong approver or not being routed at all. Delegation and manual selection errors are less common causes in this context but should still be considered during troubleshooting.

reference.document: Saviynt Enterprise IGA Documentation - Access Requests

questions.question: Which of the following actions should be taken in EIC for effectively managing orphan accounts to mitigate security risks in your organization?
options: Execute 'Detective Job' to identify and map orphan accounts
Disable all orphan accounts immediately without attempting to map them to valid users
Create a campaign to map orphan accounts to the users
Utilize Saviynt's out-of-the-box 'Map Orphan Accounts' action to associate orphan accounts with valid users or owners
questions.answer: Utilize Saviynt's out-of-the-box 'Map Orphan Accounts' action to associate orphan accounts with valid users or owners
questions.explanation: Orphan accounts are accounts that exist without an associated valid user, posing significant security risks. To manage these effectively in Saviynt EIC, you should utilize the out-of-the-box 'Map Orphan Accounts' action. This feature allows you to associate orphan accounts with valid users or owners, ensuring proper account management and mitigating potential security vulnerabilities. Immediate disabling of orphan accounts without analysis is not recommended, as it may disrupt legitimate access.

reference.document: Saviynt Enterprise IGA Documentation - Managing Orphan Accounts

questions.question: Which of the following configurations are required to successfully raise access requests for multiple users?
options: Select approval Workflow for Bulk Request in Security System
Select approval workflow for Bulk Request in the Endpoint
Select approval workflow for Bulk Request in global configuration
questions.answer: Select approval Workflow for Bulk Request in Security System
questions.explanation: To successfully raise access requests for multiple users in Saviynt's Enterprise Identity Cloud (EIC), it is essential to configure the approval workflow for bulk requests at the Security System level. This configuration ensures that bulk access requests are properly routed and managed according to the organization's approval processes. Configuring the workflow at the Endpoint or Global Configuration levels does not provide the necessary scope for handling bulk requests across multiple systems.

reference.document: Saviynt Enterprise Identity Cloud Administration Guide - Workflows

questions.question: EIC Administrator wants to populate only the Entitlements which belong to the selected department (dynamic attribute) during access request. Assuming customproperty stores the department name in entitlements, where can the below query be configured in EIC?
options: Config for requestable entitlement in ARS
questions.explanation: The correct configuration to dynamically filter entitlements during an access request is by using an access query in the endpoint. This approach ensures that only entitlements associated with the selected department (dynamic attribute) are displayed in the application request form. According to the use case 'Customize the application request form' in the Saviynt documentation, dynamic attributes and entitlement grouping are configured within the Endpoint Details and Entitlement Type tabs to control visibility and populate entitlements dynamically. Other options, such as global configuration or ARS settings, do not support context-specific queries for filtering entitlements during a request.

reference.document: Saviynt EIC Documentation - Implementing Access Requests for Applications and Endpoints

questions.question: If a change password request is created through the ARS page for a particular account from the tile 'reset the account password for others'. Which password policy will be applicable?
options: Password policy set with scope as 'APPLICATION' assigned to the 'Policy Rule' in the security system
Password policy set with scope as 'APPLICATION' assigned to the 'Policy Rule' in the endpoint
Password policy set with scope as 'USER' assigned to the 'Policy Rule' in the security system
Password policy set from global configuration
questions.answer: Password policy set with scope as 'USER' assigned to the 'Policy Rule' in the security system
questions.explanation: When a password change request is initiated through the ARS page for another user’s account using the tile 'reset the account password for others', the applicable password policy is determined by the policy assigned at the security system level. Specifically, when the password policy scope is set to 'USER' in the security system's policy rule, it governs password changes for user-centric actions. This approach ensures that the correct password criteria are applied when handling requests involving user accounts. The other options either involve application-level or global configurations, which are not prioritized in this case as the request is scoped to individual user accounts.

reference.document: Saviynt Enterprise Identity Cloud Administration Guide

questions.question: Choose the correct SQL query from the below options to populate an attribute with the logged-in user's Display Name:
options: Select DISPLAYNAME as ID from Users u where u.userkey=${loggedInUser}
Select DISPLAYNAME as ID from Users u where u.userkey=${requestor}
Select DISPLAYNAME as ID from Users u where u.userkey=${user.id}
questions.answer: Select DISPLAYNAME as ID from Users u where u.userkey=${loggedInUser}
questions.explanation: The correct query uses ${loggedInUser}, which directly retrieves the Display Name of the currently logged-in user. ${requestor} is used in scenarios where a request is made on behalf of another user, but since the question explicitly mentions 'logged-in user', ${loggedInUser} is the appropriate variable to use.

questions.question: The helpdesk has set a new password for the user who called in for password reset assistance. Choose the correct configuration to share the password with the calling user.
options: Configure an email template in Change Password Notification configurations
Setup User Update Rule and configure an email template
Configure an email template in the Reset Password notification under password policy
questions.answer: Configure an email template in the Reset Password notification under password policy
questions.explanation: The correct approach for sharing a newly reset password is to configure an email template within the Reset Password notification under the applicable password policy. This ensures that the user receives the new password in a secure and standardized manner. Other options, such as using a Change Password Notification or User Update Rule, are incorrect as they apply to different scenarios.

questions.question: The EIC administrator needs to display the list of countries stored in the Saviynt database. Which of the following are the correct options under Dynamic Attribute > 'Attribute Type' to obtain values from the database?
questions.explanation: The correct option is 'Single Select from SQL Query' because it dynamically retrieves distinct values from the Saviynt database using an SQL query, ensuring that the list of countries is always up-to-date. 'Multiple Select from List' may seem relevant since it allows selecting multiple values, but it only supports static, predefined lists, making it unsuitable for retrieving live data from the database. 'Multiple Select from SQL Query' is incorrect because it allows selecting multiple values when only a single selection is required. Lastly, 'String' allows free-text input, which does not enforce selecting valid values.

questions.question: A solution architect wants to design a form with dynamic attributes. The email address field should be displayed when a user selects the employee type as contractor and hidden when the user selects the employee type as employee. Select the correct configurations to achieve this. (multi-select)
options: Define the child attribute emailAddress with Action String
Define the parent attribute employeeType with Action String
Set "What action to perform when parent attribute changes?" of employeeType attribute to Mapping
Set "What action to perform when Parent attribute changes?" of emailAddress attribute to Mapping
answer: Define the parent attribute employeeType with Action String
Set "What action to perform when parent attribute changes?" of employeeType attribute to Mapping
Set "What action to perform when Parent attribute changes?" of emailAddress attribute to Mapping
questions.explanation: To dynamically display or hide the emailAddress field based on the employee type selection, the parent attribute (employeeType) requires an Action String. This Action String defines when the child attribute (emailAddress) should be shown or hidden. Additionally, a mapping action must be configured for the parent attribute to trigger updates to the child attribute, and the child attribute must be linked to the parent attribute with its own mapping action. The Action String is defined only for the parent attribute, not the child attribute.

questions.question: what are the different types of email notifiations that can be triggered from campaign? (multi-select)
during a user manager campaign, if one of the managers leaves the organization, how will the certifications be transferred?
options: certifications will automatically get transferred to new manager based on rule
it is not possible for an active campaign
manually update the certifications and modify managers
run a campaign job to update manager
questions.answer: certifications will automatically get transferred to new manager based on rule

questions.question: a certifier wants to certify his/her access. Does Saviynt allow to perform this in a role owner campaign?
options: No, certifiers are not permitted to take actions on their own access
Access can only be certified by Managers
yes, it is configurable to take actions on their own access
yes, by default certifiers are permitted to take actions on their own access
questions.answer: No, certifiers are not permitted to take actions on their own access

while running the access import job, what is the RANK of the owner imported into the EIC from the Target Application?
what configurations are used in the JSON to verify the API URL and the response in the log file?
EIC Admin encounters an error "Connection Name Specified in accountJSON is not found" while running the WSRETRY job. Which JSON needs to be corrected?
options: update the correct connection name in ImportAccountJSON
update the correct connection name in ImportUserJSON
update the correct connection name in CreateAccountJSON
update the correct connection name in ImportAccountEntJSON
questions.answer: update the correct connection name in ImportAccountJSON

questions.question: Which parameter can be used to manipulate data while importing from the target application in REST connector?

While troubleshooting a REST Connector account provisioning issue, the EIC administrator wants to view the API response in the logs. Which attribute will the administrator enable under CreateAccountJSON to hide or show API response received from the target applications?
options: NO configuration needed, API responses are always logged in EIC Debug logs
questions.answer: NO configuration needed, API responses are always logged in EIC Debug logs

questions.question: Which credential vaults are supported by the Active Directory connector? (multi-select)
questions.explanation:
Saviynt’s Active Directory connector supports integration with multiple credential vaults to securely retrieve and manage credentials. The supported credential vaults include:

- **HashiCorp Vault**: Offers secure storage and retrieval of secrets required for connecting to Active Directory.
- **CyberArk Vault**: Supports integration for credential management with both PVWA and CCP modes.

While 'BeyondTrust' is commonly used for privileged access management, it is not listed as a supported vault for Saviynt's Active Directory connector.

reference.document: Saviynt Enterprise Identity Cloud Documentation - Active Directory Integration Overview

questions.question: which application is NOT supported by EIC Group management
which of the following details can be updated for a group using EIC Group Management?
options: basic details of the group in the role details page
add or remove owners for the roles in the Role Owner page
Modify the rank of a role owner
questions.answer: basic details of the group in the role details page

questions.question: which of the following steps are mandatory to execute 'Deprovision Role' as a default action for Analytics?
options: ensure that the 'Execute Default action for analytics' check box is selected in RunAllAnalytics job
ensure that the 'Deprovision Role' is not defined as 'Default_Action_for_Analytics' in the analytics query
analytics query must have not userkey attribute
questions.answer: ensure that the 'Execute Default action for analytics' check box is selected in RunAllAnalytics job

questions.question: Which of the following use cases are achievable using the Analytics module in EIC? (Select 2 options)
options: Send a separate email to each user record of the analytic report
Find out the orphan accounts and map them to respective users
Use analytics to erase PII data for inactive users
Create actionable analytics to change user password
answer: Send a separate email to each user record of the analytic report
Find out the orphan accounts and map them to respective users
questions.explanation: The Analytics module in EIC enables functionalities such as sending individual email notifications based on analytic reports and identifying orphan accounts for remediation. Using analytics for PII data erasure or password change is not a supported feature.

questions.question: how can you re-trigger rules which failed to trigger without updating the users?

In EIC Service Account Management, when the current owner is terminated, how does EIC identify the new owner?
options: the new owner is defined in the current owner's user attribute : "Owner on Terminate"
the new owner is identified based on SQL query configured in global configuration
the new owner is defined in the manage owners page
the new owner is defined in the service account attribute: "Owner on Terminate"
questions.answer: the new owner is defined in the current owner's user attribute : "Owner on Terminate"

questions.question: In EIC, how is the accountname for the service account created? (choose 2 options)

enter manually while requesting a service account

as defined in connection -> create account JSON

questions.question: in saviynt app for servicenow, the manager is submitting a request for his subordinate, who is a valid SNOW user. However, when searching for the user, they are not appearing in the requests. What could be the potential issue?

SNOW user is not linked to imported saviynt user
the logged in manager requires additional access to submit request
user does not have the selected application account
questions.answer: user already has access to the selected application

questions.question: the administrator has configured EIC to create tickets in Servicenow for disconnected applications. What job does he have to configure so that EIC can sync ServiceNow ticket status with WSRETRY status?

the servicenow ticket status cannot be synchronized to EIC
WSRETRY will also sync the ticket status with EIC; no additional job is required
EIC has a built-in job that automatically polls in the background and synchronizes the status
questions.answer: status sync job needs to be configured

questions.question: After 30 days of going live, the administrator noticed connection errors with the Saviynt app for servicenow, which is used by end users to submit access requests. NO changes have been made to Saviynt EIC or Servicenow. What configuration should the administrator examine to resolve the issue? (select 2 options)

review the accesstoken used in the connection, to check if it is expired
check the service account used to generate the tokens is active
check if the service account used has access to getConnection API

questions.question: EIC is configured to create tickets in servicenow for requests for disconnected applications. The end user selects 3 different entitlements for a disconnected application and submits the request. Will EIC process this request?
options: EIC will combine all three entitlements and create one ticket in servicenow
not a valid scenario because EIC does not support multiple entitlement requests when servicenow is integrated as the ticketing system
EIC will create three separate tickets in servicenow, one for each of the three entitlements
IF the "enable multi entitlement request" option is selected, then three tickets will be created in servicenow, otherwise, only one ticket will be created
questions.answer: EIC will combine all three entitlements and create one ticket in servicenow

a newly created workflow wont appear as an active workflow in the list of worklows until it is approved from Admin > workflow> workflow approved

questions.question: Where do you enable the rule to retrofit (repair rule to user mappings) in Saviynt EIC?
questions.explanation: To enable the rule for retrofitting (repairing rule-to-user mappings) in Saviynt EIC, navigate to the Global Configuration settings. This setting ensures that any changes in user attributes are appropriately reflected in user-role or user-entitlement mappings, maintaining consistency across the system.
